  • data module

data module¶

Data encapsulation classes.

Data encapsulation that serves as middleclass between the GUI and the backend that does the actual calculations.

  • Data

  • ModelData

  • Dataset

  • CaloriData

  • EMFData

  • SpecData

  • NMRData

  • SimulationData

  • SpeciationData

  • TitrationData

class data.CaloriData(parent)¶

Bases: data.Dataset

Abstraction for calorimetric data

property Q¶
getCalcQ()¶
getQ(mask=0)¶
getResiduals(mask=0)¶
loadXML(xmle)¶

Loads the contents of an xml.etree.ElementTree.Element into this class.

Parameters

xmle (xml.etree.ElementTree) – An ElementTree containing the information to be loaded.

Raises

ValueError – if xmle has the wrong type or is not the right xml substructure.

saveXML()¶

Returns an xml.etree.ElementTree.Element containing the information from this class in order to write in the xml file.

Returns

An ElementTree containing the

information about the calorimetry data.

Return type

xml.etree.ElementTree

class data.Data¶

Bases: object

This class handles all potentiometric data together in order to better manage data transfer between different routines and help to keep consistency with the data.

property B¶

The values of the equilibrium constants array.

property Bflags¶

The values of the flags for constants refinement

property E¶

(int) the number of equilibria

property NCal¶

The number of calorimetry datasets in use

property NDatasets¶

The number of datasets currently being used.

property NEmf¶

The number of potentiometry datasets in use

property NSpec¶

The number of spectrometry datasets in use

property Nt¶

return total number of experimental points

property Nvt¶

return total number of not excluded experimental points

property P¶

The stoichiometry array of the current model.

property S¶

The number of independent components in the current model

addEquilibrium(b=0.0, pos=- 1, p=None)¶

Add a new equilibrium to the current model.

Parameters

  • b (float) – The value of the constant in decimal logarithmic units

  • pos (int) – The index of the position in which the new equilibrium will be inserted. Defaults to -1 (the last position).

  • p (numpy.ndarray) – A 1D array of S ints representing the stoichiometry associated to the new equilibrium and will be inserted as a row in the stoichiometry array. If not provided, zeros will be used.

addReagent(label='', pos=- 1)¶

Add new reagent.

Adds one additional reagent to the independent components to all models and datasets.

Parameters

  • label (str) – A label for this reagent

  • pos (int) – The position in which will be inserted

property chiSq¶

a list containing the χ₂ values of each iteration

clear()¶

Clear the content of this object and restores the initial values.

delete(what)¶

Delete the specified object.

Parameters

what (Dataset or SimulationData) – The object to be deleted

property errlogB¶

The value of the error associated to the log:sub:10 values of the constants of the current model

fit(method=0, method_pars=None)¶

Fit data.

Method for fitting the free variables defined in the flags to the experimental data. It takes no arguments and returns no value. The data is taken from this object and updates the values of the refined variables.

Parameters

  • method (int) – Indicates which algorithm will be used for fitting. Accepted values are 0 for Levenverg-Marquardt algorithm (non-linear least squares, default) and 1 for Nelder-Mead algorithm (simplex). Any other value will raise ValueError.

  • method_pars (dict) – A dict with the parameters needed for either method. They will be unpacked and passed upstream. See documentation for them.

property fullLabels¶

full list of labels

iterate()¶

Perform one iteration.

This routine does the same as fit() but it does not perform the full fitting until convergence but only one iteration is done and the the results are updated

plotCalor()¶

Provide data for plotting calorimetry data.

Yields

  1. number of datasets to plot

  2. titre used

  3. titre ignored or None

  4. heat data used

  5. heat data ignored or None

  6. volume for fit (all points)

  7. free concentration array

  8. calculated heat

  9. residuals for used points

  10. residuals for ignored points

plotEMF(plot_ignored=True)¶

Returns a generator with contains all the data needed to plot the potentiometry data.

Yields

  1. The number of datasets to plot

  2. The use flag

  3. Volume of titre

  4. Experimental data (masked)

  5. Fitted emf (masked)

  6. Free concentrations array

  7. Residuals (masked)

plotSpeciation(d, ref=None, pX=False)¶

Yield data needed to draw a spectiation plot.

Returns a generator with all the data needed to plot the species distribution.

Parameters

  • d (Dataset) – The index for the species simulation to plot

  • ref (int or None) – Optional. The index of the species for the relative concentration to be referred to. If it is none the absolute concentrations are plotted.

  • pX (bool) – Optional. Default is False. If True, the x-axis is in logarithmic units.

Yields

  1. the x-axis array

  2. the y-values

  3. the errors (or None)

  4. the labels

plotSpectr()¶

Yield data needed to plot a spectrophotometric titration.

Returns a generator with contains all the data needed to plot the spectrophotometric data.

Yields

  1. The number of datasets to plot

  2. The total number of spectra sets to plot

  3. A generator that return all spectra in turn

  4. A generator with all residuals in turn

  5. fit spectra

class data.ModelData(parent, name='noname')¶

Bases: object

This class contains and manages the data corresponding to a model, namely the equilibrium constants, the stoichiometric coefficients and other.

Here the following data are encapsulated:

  • the equilibrium constants which is an numpy.ndarray that

    contains the values of the equilibrium constants in decimal logarithmic units.

  • the error of the equilibrium constants is an numpy.ndarray

    that represents the error of the equilibrium constants in decimal logarithmic units.

  • the refinement flags for the constants which is a list of ints

    representing what to do with the constants. Accepted values are -1 for ignoring this constant, 0 for not refine this constant, 1 for refining this constant, 2 and more for constraining the constant.

  • the stoichiometry array.

property B¶

The values of the equilibrium constants array.

Note

This is the full array, including ignored values.

property Bflags¶

The flags for the equilibrium constants array.

Note

This is the full array, including ignored values.

property E¶
property P¶

The stoichiometry array of the current model.

property S¶

The number of independent components

addCalorimetry()¶

Add calorimetry data to the current model.

addEquilibrium(b=0.0, pos=- 1, p=None)¶

Adds a new equilibrium to the model

Parameters

  • b (float) – The value of the constant in decimal logarithmic units

  • pos (int) – The index of the position in which the new equilibrium will be inserted. Defaults to -1 (the last position).

  • p (numpy.ndarray) – A 1D array of S ints representing the stoichiometry associated to the new equilibrium and will be inserted as a row in the stoichiometry array. If not provided, zeros will be used.

addReagent(pos=- 1, p=None)¶

Adds a new reagent (independent component) to the model

Parameters

  • pos (int) – The index of the position in which the new reagent will be inserted. Defaults to -1 (the last position).

  • p (numpy.ndarray) – An int or 1D array of E ints representing the stoichiometry associated to the new reagent with respect to all the equilibria and will be inserted as a column in the stoichiometry array. If not provided, zeros will be used. If it is an int, that number will be used for all.

class data.SpecData(parent)¶

Bases: data.Dataset

This class handles all spectrometric data that belongs to the same titration.

MODEL_LINEAR = 0¶
property Nds¶

The number of spectra sets

property Nl¶

The number of wavelength available

addSpectra(spectra, sptype=0)¶

Adds a spectra set to the collection. A spectra set is usually a titration with N experimental points each with a spectrum of Nl wavelengths + 1 column for wavelength values.

Parameters

  • spectra (numpy.ndarray) – A 2D array containing the data.

  • stype (int) – Optional. The type of spectrum.

addSpectraFromFile(f, sptype=0)¶

Load spectra from a data file using numpy routines

Returns the calculated spectra.

ignorePt(nset, wl, sp)¶

Ignores a specific point from a given spectrum set.

Parameters

  • nset (int) – Index of the spectra set to which the wavelength is referred.

  • sp (int) – Index of the spectrum that will be ignored.

  • wl (int) – Index of the wavelength that will be ignored.

Raises

IndexError – if any of the indices are incorrect

class data.SpeciationData(parent)¶

Bases: data.SimulationData

calcC(x, erlvl=None)¶

This function calculates the free concentrations and the errors.

Parameters

  • x (int) – a valid index indicating which of the independent components will be used as independent variable.

  • erlvl (float) – The error level at which the error in the free concentrations will be calculated. If None, no error will be calculated.
